intro: Sida panamaensis, commonly known as Panama sida, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Sida panamaensis is known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
